privacy_policy.heading: Privacy Policy
privacy_policy.content: This privacy policy is created to protect the privacy of users of Questr. This policy informs you about how we use our site, what information we collect, how we use this information, and with whom we share it.
privacy_policy.collected_information_content: We do not collect personal information to identify our users. However, we may collect technical information such as usage statistics, browser information, IP addresses to better understand and improve our service.
privacy_policy.cookies_content: Our website may use cookies to enhance visitor experience and gather statistical information. You can change your browser settings to accept or reject cookies.
privacy_policy.third_party_links_content: Our site may contain links to third-party websites. When using these links, it is important to check their privacy policies. We do not have control over the content or privacy practices of third-party sites.
privacy_policy.security_content: We take industry-standard security measures to protect your personal information. However, we cannot guarantee the security of communication over the internet.
privacy_policy.changes_content: This privacy policy may be updated from time to time. It is your responsibility to review the current policy to track changes.
privacy_policy.contact_content: If you have any questions about our privacy policy, please feel free to contact us.

about.about_description: Questr is a fun social platform aimed at users for personal question-and-answer sharing with friends. It's crafted with love by Ilker Akyel using Nest.js and React. It's purely for entertainment purposes.
about.heading: About
about.technologies_used_content: The technologies used in the development of Questr are as follows:
about.socket_content: For real-time notification management, Socket.io has been utilized. Instant notifications assist in facilitating interactions.
about.mongo_content: The aim was flexibility and scalability in database operations. Hence, Mongo was chosen as the database for Questr.
about.graphql_content: GraphQL was used in communication with the API Gateway. It enables flexible and efficient presentation of data requested by the client.
about.kubernetes_content: Questr was developed using a microservices architecture. While employing microservices, GRPC was utilized for communication between the API gateway and services. Docker-Kubernetes was preferred for managing the services, API Gateway, and Front-End.
about.react_content: React was chosen for Questr's interface. By using React, the aim was to achieve a dynamic and interactive web experience as a single-page application, eliminating the need for page refresh. Tailwind and Flowbite was used to support the design process, while i18next facilitated the creation of a multilingual structure.
about.nest_content: Node.js framework, Nest.js, was employed in the backend development of Questr. Its selection was based on its support for microservices architecture, its built-in packages for technologies like GraphQL and gRPC, and its well-provided documentation.
